# The `LookAheadHeuristics` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A helper class used for scoring candidates for two consecutive lanes. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::slpvectorizer::BoUpSLP::LookAheadHeuristics</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

A helper class used for scoring candidates for two consecutive lanes.

Definition at line 1687 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/slpvectorizer-cpp">SLPVectorizer.cpp</a>.

### LookAheadHeuristics() {#a8e14accdaa3da86f319cd54a73cf7e79}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::slpvectorizer::BoUpSLP::LookAheadHeuristics::LookAheadHeuristics (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a> &amp; TLI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp; SE, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slpvectorizer/boupslp">BoUpSLP</a> &amp; R, int NumLanes, int MaxLevel)</>}

## Public Member Functions

### getScoreAtLevelRec() {#a54d9af6b4c656c782e017020406e8291}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int llvm::slpvectorizer::BoUpSLP::LookAheadHeuristics::getScoreAtLevelRec (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; RHS, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; U1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; U2, int CurrLevel, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; &gt; MainAltOps) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Go through the operands of <code>LHS</code> and <code>RHS</code> recursively until MaxLevel, and return the cummulative score.

<code>U1</code> and <code>U2</code> are the users of <code>LHS</code> and <code>RHS</code> (that is <code>LHS</code> and <code>RHS</code> are operands of <code>U1</code> and <code>U2</code>), except at the beginning of the recursion where these are set to nullptr.

For example: 

<CodeBlock>
///  A&#91;0&#93;  B&#91;0&#93;  A&#91;1&#93;  B&#91;1&#93;  C&#91;0&#93; D&#91;0&#93;  B&#91;1&#93; A&#91;1&#93;
///     \\ /         \\ /         \\ /        \\ /
///      +           +           +          +
///     G1          G2          G3         G4
/// </CodeBlock> The getScoreAtLevelRec(G1, G2) function will try to match the nodes at each level recursively, accumulating the score. It starts from matching the additions at level 0, then moves on to the loads (level 1). The score of G1 and G2 is higher than G1 and G3, because &#123;A&#91;0&#93;,A&#91;1&#93;&#125; and &#123;B&#91;0&#93;,B&#91;1&#93;&#125; match with <a href="#af379975020343d71dc168188b48b3e80">LookAheadHeuristics::ScoreConsecutiveLoads</a>, while &#123;A&#91;0&#93;,C&#91;0&#93;&#125; has a score of <a href="#a653c21908b15629b676161353d43d719">LookAheadHeuristics::ScoreFail</a>. Please note that the order of the operands does not matter, as we evaluate the score of all profitable combinations of operands. In other words the score of G1 and G4 is the same as G1 and G2. This heuristic is based on ideas described in: Look-ahead SLP: Auto-vectorization in the presence of commutative operations, CGO 2018 by Vasileios Porpodas, Rodrigo C. O. Rocha, Luís F. W. Góes

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/slpvectorizer-cpp/#l01919">1919</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/slpvectorizer-cpp">SLPVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getShallowScore() {#a266c328585c72cd84dc48ef488acef49}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int llvm::slpvectorizer::BoUpSLP::LookAheadHeuristics::getShallowScore (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; U1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; U2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; &gt; MainAltOps) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
the score of placing <code>V1</code> and <code>V2</code> in consecutive lanes. <code>U1</code> and <code>U2</code> are the users of <code>V1</code> and <code>V2</code>. Also, checks if <code>V1</code> and <code>V2</code> are compatible with instructions in <code>MainAltOps</code>.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/slpvectorizer-cpp/#l01747">1747</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/slpvectorizer-cpp">SLPVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### ScoreSplatLoads {#a9bcb4a0dcff036fbe065d2d3fc070e0a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="const int llvm::slpvectorizer::BoUpSLP::LookAheadHeuristics::ScoreSplatLoads = 3"
  labels = {["static"]}>
The same load multiple times.

This should have a better score than <code>ScoreSplat</code> because it in x86 for a 2-lane vector we can represent it with <code>movddup (reg), xmm0</code> which has a throughput of 0.5 versus 0.5 for a vector load and 1.0 for a broadcast.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/slpvectorizer-cpp/#l01719">1719</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/slpvectorizer-cpp">SLPVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="const int llvm::slpvectorizer::BoUpSLP::LookAheadHeuristics::ScoreUndef = 1"
